record.title: MORNING BUSINESS

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that there now be a period for the transaction of morning business, with Senators allowed to speak therein for up to 10 minutes each.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I further ask unanimous consent that Senator Salazar be recognized for up to 5 minutes, followed by Senator Allard for up to 5 minutes.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
record.narrative: (The remarks of Mr. Salazar and Mr. Allard pertaining to the introduction of S. 194 are printed in today's RECORD under "Statements on Introduced Bills and Joint Resolutions.")
record.chair: The Senator from Maine is recognized.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that I be permitted to proceed for 17 minutes.

Mr. President, before the two Senators from Colorado leave the floor, let me just indicate that the legislation they introduced to honor former President Ford would be referred to the Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee, and as the ranking member of that committee, I wish to pledge my cooperation to them in moving this legislation. It is a fitting tribute.
I thank the Senator from Colorado. I appreciate all her fine work on that committee, and I really appreciate it for all the people of Colorado.
